description.raw:
It should be possible to compile Ignition Gazebo even if DART is not installed. We should also let users load their own physics engines.

This PR removes the hard dependency on DART and lets users choose other physics engines at runtime. Ignition Gazebo will still try to load DART by default, but will fail to load physics if DART's Ignition Physics plugin can't be found. An error is printed and simulation keeps running without physics.

See tutorial below for usage.

This can be tested using the hello world engine from [this pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/119/add-simple-example-of-physics-plugin-and/diff) and [this world](https://gist.github.com/chapulina/a3e13b25e5f325ea972e16b9c8ecb51a):

```
cd ign-physics/examples/hello_world
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
cd ..
IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=`pwd`/build ign gazebo -v 1 build/rolling_box.sdf
```

You should see the message:

`[Err] [Physics.cc:308] Engine [mock::HelloWorldPlugin] is missing required features and can't be loaded.`

Another option is to use the command line, for example:

`IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=`pwd`/build ign gazebo -v 1 --physics-engine HelloWorldPlugin shapes.sdf`

If you try without the env var, you'll see:

`[Err] [Physics.cc:287] Failed to find plugin [libHelloWorldPlugin.so]. Have you checked the IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH environment variable?`

:warning: **Out of scope:**

* automatically choosing an appropriate physics engine based on the features needed by the simulation
* supporting engines with a different set of features - see pull request #573 for that

---

## ~~TODO~~ DONE

~~I'd like to apply the same idea of pull request #222 to Ignition Physics so that the engine plugins are also installed to unvesioned files and users can use that on the SDF.~~ This pull request now depends on [this ign-physics PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/121/) .
description.html:
It should be possible to compile Ignition Gazebo even if DART is not installed. We should also let users load their own physics engines.

This PR removes the hard dependency on DART and lets users choose other physics engines at runtime. Ignition Gazebo will still try to load DART by default, but will fail to load physics if DART's Ignition Physics plugin can't be found. An error is printed and simulation keeps running without physics.

See tutorial below for usage.

This can be tested using the hello world engine from this pull request and this world:

cd ign-physics/examples/hello_world
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
cd ..
IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=`pwd`/build ign gazebo -v 1 build/rolling_box.sdf

You should see the message:

[Err] [Physics.cc:308] Engine [mock::HelloWorldPlugin] is missing required features and can't be loaded.

Another option is to use the command line, for example:

IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=pwd/build ign gazebo -v 1 --physics-engine HelloWorldPlugin shapes.sdf

If you try without the env var, you'll see:

[Err] [Physics.cc:287] Failed to find plugin [libHelloWorldPlugin.so]. Have you checked the IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH environment variable?

Out of scope:

  • automatically choosing an appropriate physics engine based on the features needed by the simulation
  • supporting engines with a different set of features - see pull request #573 for that

TODO DONE

I'd like to apply the same idea of pull request #222 to Ignition Physics so that the engine plugins are also installed to unvesioned files and users can use that on the SDF. This pull request now depends on this ign-physics PR .

title: Find custom physics engines

This PR removes the hard dependency on DART and lets users choose other physics engines at runtime. An error is printed and simulation keeps running without physics.

See tutorial below for usage.

This can be tested using the hello world engine from this pull request and this world:

cd ign-physics/examples/hello_world
mkdir build

cmake ..
make
cd ..
IGN_GAZEBO_PHYSICS_ENGINE_PATH=`pwd`/build ign gazebo -v 1 build/rolling_box.sdf

[Err] [Physics.cc:308] Engine [mock::HelloWorldPlugin] is missing required features and can't be loaded.

TODO DONE

I'd like to apply the same idea of pull request #222 to Ignition Physics so that the engine plugins are also installed to unvesioned files and users can use that on the SDF. This pull request now depends on this ign-physics PR .
